content:
@Forest Anderson [he/him] The post is live at:

https://smallcultfollowing.com/babysteps//blog/2021/11/15/ctcft-2021-11-22-agenda/

Did you want to tweet about it?

Posted :+1: https://twitter.com/RustCTCFT/status/1460319200745033733

The topic of the November CTCFT will be Rust for Linux! The meetup will be a week later than normal, on the 22nd of November instead of the 15th. https://smallcultfollowing.com/babysteps//blog/2021/11/15/ctcft-2021-11-22-agenda/

- Rust Cross Team Collaboration Fun Times (@RustCTCFT)
Sent out another Tweet, we should be good to go!
The CTCFT will be starting in 20 minutes!
Just wanted to say "thanks" to the Rust in Linux people for sharing! This was a really interesting presentation and the discussion afterwards was great as well!
Very interested in the topic. When will the recording be uploaded to youtube?

Thanks everyone who came out to the Rust for Linux CTCFT! I really loved the conversations that were had at the social hour :smiley: I'm wondering, since this is the first CTCFT with outside presentations (as far as I recall), how did people feel it went? Also, are there other external teams/topics that would be worth reaching out to for future CTCFTs? I'd love to hear your thoughts!
I'm willing to talk about rustdoc at length :laughing: not sure how interesting a topic it would be though
@Joshua Nelson are you saying that rustdoc is an external team? :)
I thought it worked well, in any case, but I'm pondering how to take action on the follow-up
Nope, I just can't read :joy:
Good, I was worried for a second there.
